<casebody firstpage="79" lastpage="79" xmlns="http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:HLS.Libr.US_Case_Law.Schema.Case_Body:v1">
 <parties id="p-1">
  IN RE: Charles Everette HINTON
 </parties>
 <docketnumber id="p-2">
  449P11-22
 </docketnumber>
 <court id="p-3">
  Supreme Court of North Carolina.
 </court>
 <decisiondate id="p-4">
  August 14, 2019
 </decisiondate>
 <attorneys id="p-5">
  Charles E. Hinton, For Hinton, Charles Everette
 </attorneys>
 <attorneys id="p-6">
  Daniel P. O'Brien, Special Deputy Attorney General, For State of N.C.
 </attorneys>
 <opinion id="p-7">
  The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 17th of June 2019 by Plaintiff for En Banc Ex Parte Replevin at Common-Law Action
 </opinion>
 <opinion id="p-8">
  "Motion Dismissed by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2019."
 </opinion>
 <opinion type="majority">
  <author id="p-9">
   Ervin, J. recused
  </author>
 </opinion>
</casebody>
